pr_title: Allow the validator to pass for NUMERIC attributes starting with > and < symbols

timeline.message: allow NUMERIC attribites to start with > and < symbols
allow >,< in first position and check if the rest is number

timeline.bodyText:
@zhx828 @kalletlak I think this is prolly ok to merge, but maybe we should create a new issue to indicate that that there should be a NUMBER_RANGE data_type or something along those lines. What do you think?
also how is this handled on the study view for barcharts like e.g.:
timeline.author: inodb
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2461,7 +2461,10 @@ def checkLine(self, data):
                 pass
             elif data_type == 'NUMBER':
                 if not self.checkFloat(value):
-                    self.logger.error(
+                	if (value[0] in ('>','<')) and value[1:].isdigit():
+                		pass
+                	else:
+                		self.logger.error(

replies.bodyText: so @rmadupuri validated that this works by importing some studies like this to triage. But yeah still curious what y'all think @zhx828 @kalletlak
replies.author: inodb

replies.bodyText: @inodb this kind of data has been in the portal for quite while now. SV handles it by treating it as the max/min value then group the rest of data together. I'm ok with NUMBER_RANGE, but no sure how frequent it will be used though.
replies.author: zhx828
